technologies.name: JavaScript
technologies.summary: Good understanding of fundamentals, OOP (classic and prototypal inheritance), basic design patterns.

technologies.name: ES6
technologies.summary: Good understanding of the most used aspects of it, such as Promises, arrow functions, destructuring assignments and much more.

technologies.name: TypeScript
technologies.summary: Good understanding of the positives it brings on the table.

technologies.name: HTML
technologies.summary: Good understanding of the basic structure, the basic tags and most of their attributes and properties. Slightly lacking in terms of semantics.

technologies.name: CSS
technologies.summary: Good understanding of the normal flow, the basic layouts, the difference between inline and block, slightly lacking in terms of browser support for the various vendors.

technologies.name: Python
technologies.summary: Very basic understanding with very limited experience.

technologies.name: jQuery
technologies.summary: Good knowledge of jQuery DOM manipulations, AJAX, effects.

technologies.name: Bootstrap
technologies.summary: Good understanding of the bootstrap grid.

technologies.name: Angular 2/4
technologies.summary: Good knowledge of the basic building blocks, the dependency injection, the decorators and the metadata they are using, slightly lacking in terms of experience (this will probably change in the near future).

technologies.name: Responsive design
technologies.summary: Very good understanding of media queries, very good feeling for responsive UX.

technologies.name: AJAX
technologies.summary: Very good understanding on asynchronous programming, higher order functions and Promises.

technologies.name: Node.JS
technologies.summary: Good understanding of its modular and asynchronous nature, slightly lacking in terms of built-in modules knowledge.

technologies.name: ExpressJS
technologies.summary: Good understanding of the way it works, the concept of its middlewares, the routing and the error handling it offers.

technologies.name: MongoDB
technologies.summary: Good understanding on how to use it for something small.

technologies.name: RESTful API
technologies.summary: Good understanding of RESTful APIs, able to create simple RESTful APIs with simple authentication methods

technologies.name: Coding style
technologies.summary: I am always using good practices, defined by ESLint, TSLint, although I am still not used to CSSLint.

technologies.name: Git / GitHub
technologies.summary: Good knowledge of how to use them, both in GUI and CLI, good understanding of the concept of Git Flow and decent understanding in using it.

technologies.name: Testing frameworks
technologies.summary: Decent knowledge of unit testing frameworks (Mocha, Chai, Sinon), basic understanding of integration and browser tests, including some experience with Selenium Webdriver

technologies.name: Algorithms and data structures
technologies.summary: Very basic understanding, but I am somewhat good at math so this might change.
